image.altText: A younger man holds a backetball.

props.synopsis: For Jazz, a racing heart used to be a bad thing. Now, as he competes in the Australian Transplant Games, it's a sign he's living life to the full after organ donation.Â

title.children: A racing heart used to be scary for Jazz but after organ donation it means he's having a good game

image.altText: A woman stands behind a podium speaking into a microphone with Liberal Party posters surrounding her.

props.synopsis: The Canberra Liberals launch their bid to win back government in the ACT, with leader Elizabeth Lee joined at an event in the city's south by former chief minister Kate Carnell and the party faithful.

title.children: Canberra Liberals launch bid to retake government, declaring 23 years in opposition 'is long enough'

image.altText: A large group of protesters carry banners and flags and shout chants.

props.synopsis: Pro-Palestine groups have rallied in Sydney, Melbourne and Adelaide on the eve of the first anniversary of the October 7 attack.

title.children: Thousands gather at pro-Palestine marches around the country

image.altText: Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory

props.synopsis: Disgusted, angry and heartbroken is how the mother of a 10-year-old girl, molested by a family friend, has described her feelings as the man was sentenced to jail in the ACT Magistrates Court.

title.children: Ten-year-old victim slams child molester as 'purely disgusting' in victim impact statement

image.altText: Jack Howarth lies under Panthers players as Storm players celebrate

props.synopsis: Cameron Munster's season ends with allegations he bit a Panther, while the Bunker supported a no-try decision but Melbourne believed footage showed the ball on the ground. Here are the quick hits from the 2024 NRL grand final.

title.children: Grand final quick hits: NRL says bunker made correct call on disallowed try, as Melbourne star is accused of biting

image.altText: A young woman wearing a black t-shirt emblazoned with a sunflower sits at a small outside table.

props.synopsis: The 28-year-old is training to become a paramedic in the hope she can "make a difference" to anyone suffering the way her loved ones did.

title.children: After losing 10 people to suicide, Sofia's joining the front lines of Australia's mental health battle

image.altText: A close up of a man wearing a hoodie with his face blurred as he stares at a computer screen.

props.synopsis: Scammers are targeting Australians in offshore call centres as they're seen as "easy prey", according to a young migrant who used to work in an Ukrainian call centre.

title.children: This former scammer explains how Australians are being targeted by overseas call centres

image.altText: A close up of a bald man wearing a striped shirt standing in his garage.

props.synopsis: Soaring power bills and plunging incentives for excess solar power are pushing more Australian households into installing home energy storage. Yet these batteries are still very expensive and don't stack up for many.

title.children: 'There's a supply glut': The problem with solar feed-in tariffs

image.altText: A person voting at a booth in the ACT election

image.altText: A composite image of two men and two women

props.synopsis: One year ago today, Hamas-led terrorists infiltrated southern Israel from Gaza and went on a rampage. In this oral history, survivors recall the deadliest attack on Jews in a single day since the Holocaust.

title.children: 'I told the kids to scream': How Israel's worst day unfolded, told by the people who lived through it

image.altText: A woman cries and leans on a body that is covered with the Israeli flag.

props.synopsis: October 7 was not just another wave of Middle East violence; it was a massacre and kidnapping so unconscionable and cruel it has radically changed everything. But as we mark this day, a deal for peace seems further away than ever.

title.children: Politicians have warned against protesting today, but their words cannot control the visceral grief of Australians

image.altText: A person inspects a large crater in the ground at night.

image.altText: A woman with grey hair sits in a chair in a house, looking out the window.

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

image.altText: A small snail with a shell on its back with a swirl. It is sitting on a dark log.
